name: Refrigerator Garlic Dill Spears
author: foodinjars (Marisa McClellan)
summary: These dill spears are excellent on sandwiches, eaten plain, or chopped up for a hot dog topping.
ingredients: 3 pounds kirby cucumbers (or other unwaxed, small-seeded 4- to 5-inch pickling cucumbers)
directions: Divide garlic, dill, and peppercorns between 2 clean quart jars
Wash cucumbers and trim away blossom ends
Pack spears vertically and snugly into jars
Stir together vinegar, water, and salt in a small nonreactive pot, and bring to a boil over high heat
Stir and reduce heat, if necessary, until salt dissolves
Pour or ladle hot brine into jars, covering cucumbers and leaving 1/2 inch headspace
Tap jars gently to remove any air bubbles
Add more brine if necessary to leave 1/2 inch headspace
Wipe rims clean with a damp paper towel
Let cool completely to room temperature, about 1 hour
Refrigerate at least 48 hours before eating for best flavor
) Store in refrigerator up to 1 month
